intro: Centaurea strictissima, commonly known as the strict centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, with a central yellow disk, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Centaurea strictissima is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
